utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so I hope you're feeling great as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so how may I help you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm planning to %um go to Singapore this coming May.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I really don't- honestly I really don't have any idea of what I'm going to do aside from shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh maybe you could help me %um with the %um- my destinations and where I could %um see other places like %um %uh zoos or malls.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um my- I'm planning to visit Singapore probably in May.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's going to be a three day and two nights to- so that's going to be on May three and then I'll have to leave on May five.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and you are coming with %uh- how many people are you coming with?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm going with my sister and my nephew.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's going to be the three of us.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And your nephew is below twelve?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %um well first of all we would have- over here in Singapore we speak- a lot of us speak English.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Our street signs are all in English.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you don't really have a problem with communications.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now, when you arrive in the Changi Airport, do get some Singapore money first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Exchange some money first with our money changer booth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are found both in the transit area as well as just immediately after the- %uh after you collect your bags and you exit from the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just get some smalls notes like a dollar coin, two dollars notes, and five dollars to enable you to travel on our MRT.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so first thing I wanna know %um how is the weather going to be in May?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it fine like it won't gonna rain, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's not really the raining season.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in S~ yah in Singapore we have summer the whole year round.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and %uh- well even if it rains is not a big issue because you could always spend some time in the mall, have a cup of coffee.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: By the time you finish your drinks, the rain would have stopped.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just the way I love it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So once you board the MRT, you just %uh look for the %uh machine, the ticket machine and they would tell you how much money to put in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just take note there is a deposit of one dollar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you exit from your destination, remember to take back your %uh one dollar deposit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um is there any %um a card-like %um deposit that you'll have to use for the MRT or-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um do we get us a card like %um pass?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Once you go to the ticket machine, %uh you press your destination, which particular station you want to go to and the machine will tell you how much to pay to that destination.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you will receive a card that looks like a credit card, that size.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, once you get the card you proceed to the %um entrance to the station, just tap your card, you go inside, %uh and airport that line is the green line is the East-West Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you will have to change train at the station, the second station called Tanah Merah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How do you spell Tanah Merah?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'll take a note of it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then so- %um if I'm going to %um because %uh I think %um I will like to stick on a budget. %Um-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, there are quite of few options.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Again it depends on %uh which particular area that you like to stay in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there are some %uh hotels which are fairly inexpensive %uh along Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: which is on our main shopping area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are %uh hotels that are located in another area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you look at the green line, %uh that's- it's somewhere if you look at number five which is on the South.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you move up a little bit between four and five %uh there is this area called Tiong Bahru.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there's a hotel there as well called Link Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise if you again follow the green line, you will come to %uh Bugis, there's also hotel there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you move up a little bit that's Lavender.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you go down a little bit to the yellow line, Bras Basah %uh there is also a hotel out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you move up the red line to Orchard Road, Orchard- can you see Orchard?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there is two other hotels there, York Hotel, Elizabeth Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they are I would say %um reasonable rates and yet you are very %uh right in the heart of the city.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: When you say "reasonable rates" %um %uh could you give me like an assumption amount?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, %uh per night %uh in the range of %uh a hundred and sixty dollars right up to two hundred dollars per room.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um I could rent a room with- %um together with my sister and my nephew.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh we can stay in one room, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, and you probably would require an extra bed for your nephew.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh So this is the hotel area that you are talking about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Of course you like to %uh spend a little bit more then again there are other hotels that you may want to consider along Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Of course like international hotels we have Hyatt Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's near to the Somerset MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In between Somerset and %uh Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So basically %um along this %um %uh so I could see a map.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um this is like an MRT map, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh so I will just have to follow %um- I will just have to rode %um MRT to get to another hotel, and then to another hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Unless you planning to change hotel every night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you take the MRT for sightseeing %uh. I'm showing this %uh MRT map for you get a feel of the different %uh lines that we have.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And just to show you the hotel location for the various %uh hotels that I'm recommending.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so there are very conveniently located because they are very near to the MRT and- it's- the MRT is actually a very inexpensive way of travelling in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's what I want to hear con~ the conveniency with the travel, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so %um if I wanted to like shop for %um if I'm going to stay for example in %um Orchard and then I would like to shop.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um where would you %um suggest for me to go?`

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um where would you %um suggest for me to go?`

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we have a over in- near the Somerset MRT, there are a few shopping centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Actually the whole stretch from Orchard station right to Dhoby Ghaut every other hotel or building it's either a hotel or a shopping mall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So our shopping hours starts from ten A.M. to nine thirty every day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do lots of shopping options out there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, so I can stretch- I need to stretch my legs before I get to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you sho~ Yah, you have to do a little bit of %uh exercise before you come and do your shopping out here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the shopping area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there's always a lot of %uh things to do out here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are tired, just go in to any of the cafés, %um have a smoothie or cold drink, coffee, tea, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I guess for your nephew, you may want to do some sightseeing %uh with him as well, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could do a little bit of %uh sightseeing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let say you are staying somewhere on Orchard Road, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The hotel that I was talking about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in the range of two hundred dollars, you could take the subway and you alight at City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You look down the red line City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh you go to this and you just walk about five minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and it's a nice area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You just walk along the bay %uh the bay area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Esplanade and you will see this %uh lion which is an icon of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um but it- %um I've seen it on the %um Internet, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh, so from City Hall, I will just have to %um walk %um five minutes?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that five minutes along- five minutes from the City Hall?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, five minutes to the Padang Area, it's a shady spot.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can walk and then you will come to the Merlion

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I would say about ten minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can take nice picture out there because the Merlion is a symbol of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from there, you can go- opposite is a  %uh nice building.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can take a picture of this %uh building out there and that is the Fullerton Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can continue on your journey because the Merlion is located in the financial district of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you will just use the underpass to go across to the opposite side of the Merlion, and you will board your train at the Raffles Place MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from there you take the West Line.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can you show me a map perhaps?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um. Along the %um- is- where is that Merli~ %um around %uh the Merlion icon, %um %uh are there any place that where we could buy some giveaways which we could take home for our friends?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay, you don't really have to buy it from the Merlion area, but there is a shop, a small shop at the Merlion Area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, now I'm showing you the map of %uh what I'm talking about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Merlion, can you see on the top-right hand corner?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so you walk underneath the- %uh underpass.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, that is the Raffles Place MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just at this corner here, there is actually a shop there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you want to pick up some %uh souvenirs, like the Merlion keychain and all that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You know, you pick it up there then you board the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you will go down to the cha~ %uh Tanjong Pagar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You alight at Tanjong Pagar because I'm going to introduce you to the Chinatown area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then- Yah, so I do understand you have %uh Chinatown in Philippines, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm but it is a little bit different from what we have here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and you may want to visit the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They call the Thian Hock Keng Temple.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thian- So when I go to the temple, do I need to bring anything?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well, just be appropriately dressed like %uh no short shorts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and try to put on like shirt or t-shirts with sleeves

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So they are particular basically with def~ how we dress.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm gonna show you the image of %uh Thian Hock Keng Temple there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It says that %uh right now we are doing some restoration work to the temple, but it's one of our oldest Chinese- is our oldest Chinese Temple.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um with this %um temple, we cannot go in since going to be restorated, is that correct?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then we can take pictures outside or?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you ar~ Yes, you are allowed to take pictures outside the Chinese temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In fact the most beautiful part of the temple would be the roof, where you see a lot of dragons, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The roof it looks like bamboo, because according to the Chinese, the bamboos are a symbol of long life.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But they are not made by bamboo, they are made of tiles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's built like- it looks like a bamboo, that's all.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh you could still do %uh- you could still go inside although the temple is undergoing restoration.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just a feel %uh and a god %uh in this particular temple is dedicated to the goddess of the sea call Ma Zhu Po.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could have a look inside, this Chinese temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And when you leave the temple, this picture shows you the main entrance of the temple, you turn to your right-hand side okay, you walk about %uh four hundred metres and you will come to a hawker centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: H A W K E R it is a non-air-conditioned food centre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And what do I do there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, you can have your lunch there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because the price it's very reasonable.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %um So %uh do they have like a specialty in that %um restaurant?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's all little shop which is about %uh a hundred metre kind of a shop, hundred square metre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and they sell a lot of different kind of food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh so it's variety of food, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's a variety %uh ranging from Chinese food to %uh Malay and you can eat to Indian and you can even get some Western meals there as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh some of the local dishes, you may want to try it out, would be %um carrot cake.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's not what you think the carrot looks like.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I would like to try that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is our version of carrot cake.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's radish fried with %uh flour and egg.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And sometimes it looks a bit dark because they have been cook with a %uh dark sauce.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, now can you see the word- the highlighted area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you see the red %um- Thian Hock Keng Temple, if you look at Ayer- Telok Ayer Street?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are here, remember I said when you leave the temple, you turn right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's about a four hundred metres walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and you actually pass by the Al-Abrar Mosque.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The highlighted area again, that's %um a mosque.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's a place of worship for the Muslim.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh %uh normally if you are non-Muslims, we don't encourage you to go in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You stand outside, you could actually look inside.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So and then you just turn to the left again, you come to the Amoy Street Food Centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so just look around the food centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are always %uh photos of the food that each of this vendor %uh sell.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, and again do carry a bit of Singapore money with you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: 'Cause they are like a few dollars each.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like %uh carrot cake would probably cost about %uh two fifty, two dollars fifty cents to three dollars for one plate.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Definitely I would try that carrot cake.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's actually- yes it's quite different from the %uh kind of a baked carrot cake that we often, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the Chinese version.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh of course there are lots of other delicious food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you are not so %uh- if you just want something a little bit light then, you could try our fish soup with noodles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that would cost you a meal there would cost you three dollars for a main dish, and a drink will be in the region of a cold drink in a region of a dollar forty cents.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, there is a pathway, %uh a kind of steps where you climb up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you arrive at Ann Siang Hill.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Ann Siang Hill in green, can you see that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh these are very nice houses out here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um interesting I would say because some of the houses here has two doors.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The outer door which is smaller like a cowboy door.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah and then they have a bigger door.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are own traditionally by the Peranakan Chinese.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That means the strait born Chinese.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah so bit- it's a nice row of houses here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you come to South Bridge Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you walk against the traffic

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From here you can see Sri Mariamman Temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so this is an Indian temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we are doing your tour in the morning.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the Sri Mariamman Temple will be open 'til twelve o'clock in the afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In the afternoon, they still keep the front gates opened.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But there will not be so much activities going on in the afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm so it's much better to %um go there in the morning, I guess.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes so you can do that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh take a look and you have to remove your shoes before you go into the Indian Temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just put your shoes %uh in the shoe racks.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah and do a short walk in the temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And when you're out, you turn left to Pagoda Street.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again you will see a lot of the Chinatown %uh houses with this bamboo roof.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you also mention you like to pick up some souvenirs.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah so there are some Chinese souvenirs that you may want to pick up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can just walk around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are some coffee shops, coffee shops meaning %uh non-air-conditioned drinking places and food place~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So anytime you are hungry or thirsty, you can always pick up some food or drinks along the-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you follow this road again down to Trengganu Street.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you make a left turn.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now on Sago Street, there are about two shops there that sells %uh specifically Chinese pastry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, that you may not see in the normal %uh kind of bakery.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are all sorts of Chinese pastry there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh and if you again want to visit another Chinese temple there is another Chinese temple %uh called the Buddha Relic Temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just in-between Sago Street and Sago Lane.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um let's say if I wanted to %um go to a park or a zoo for my nephew, so where can I go?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I would recommend the morning or afternoon zoo for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so that like you can do like a half day, %uh almost full day already, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because you were walking from the Merlion right up to the Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I guess with all this walk, you would be a little bit tired.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So in the night time, you may just want to %uh rest up for- %uh rest for a little while before you head out for dinner.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we will come back to the dinner places later on.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um where is this zoo located?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the zoo is located in the %uh North part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh- %um how do I get there?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do I rode the train or how's the mode of transportation to %um- going to the zoo from %um let say Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we do have the zoo express %uh that you can take.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh as you can see there are different timings and %uh different %uh places of %uh pick-up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise, you can take the subway, the MRT, to Ang Mo Kio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from there you board a bus to the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh okay so it's a Night Safari?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is the morning and afternoon zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if he- if your nephew like the different- %uh the animals, you can do combine both together.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I would suggest if you want to do two attractions, you can do in the afternoon,

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh and dinner out in the zoo or Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are food and beverages and fast food available in both the %um zoo and the Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh in the day zoo this will be more %uh mammals that you see in the day zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can also do- %uh there's also a tram ride that you can take, and then %uh in the middle of the zoo, you can alight and walk around, do a little bit of the %uh attractions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you board back the tram.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, same thing with the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Night Safari, you were going to see different animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Night Safari will be %uh ninety per cent- %uh it's, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Ninety per cent will be nocturnal creatures, %uh like the leopards, the tigers which are nocturnal creatures.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, our zoo- both our zoo and Night Safari so they are called open zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they are thro~ they are put in %uh as close as possible to what they would live in the wild.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They do not come out of their so-called enclosure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's beautiful, it's like park, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is- I'm showing you now %uh just portion of the day zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And let's go to the Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is our Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so you can see the first picture?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you'll be getting on this tram.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and these animals are wild creatures, so do not stretch out any part of your body.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, and do not touch the animals, they are wild animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The leopards %uh they are separated from you by the glass enclosure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are we allowed to feed them?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no feeding because they are wild animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the zoo and the Night Safari have a standard %uh feeding time for the animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we don't want them to get overweight, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is %uh- it will be very interesting.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You get on the tram ride and in the middle %uh there is a stop called The Leopard's Trail, you get off the tram, do a half an hour walk, to see the animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Come back and take the next tram and you are back at the entrance.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So on the tram ride it's about forty minutes excluding the walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and at the e~ main entrance, there is another walking trail called The Fishing Cat Trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the %uh Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are like shows if your nephew is interested, we have the Creatures of the Night Show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what the Safari do is they bring up some of the animals, the smaller animals, and %uh- It's just a- it's a simple show %uh to show you how basically animals behave.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, we don't dress them up because they are still wild animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the show time is seven thirty, eight thirty, and nine thirty P.M. %uh if the weather permits.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the shows that you can do- %uh I would recommend a minimum of two hours in the Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Of course if you can spend three hours, that would be better.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you don't want to walk, then forty minutes on the %uh tram ride.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I definitely recommend you to do at least one walking trail at the Leopards Trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I will show you the walking trails, because on the tram ride, you see seventy per cent of the animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The balance of thirty per cent you will have to walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we divide the park into the various sector like Himalayan Foothills, the Nepalese River Valley.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah for each of the sector.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you will have %uh areas that stimulate the natural habitat of these different animals that are found in these areas.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so this is the Night Safari Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah it's a very popular tourist spot for both the locals and the tourists.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- And I guess your nephew may also be interested to do the Jurong Bird Park as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- Yah, we have like again different walks.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I think you should not miss the lorry loft.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: See now these lorries are free flying.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, but you cannot feed them with human food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we feed them with the honey water and that's available in the lorry loft itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So and the birds, the lorries will come and perch on your hand, to feed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because when you're holding this bowl of honey water, all the birds will come.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it makes a very good pictures, alright, for your family.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, and there are so colourful.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course also do not miss the show.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Definitely I would like to %um watch the show.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then %um- so for %um how much does it cost to like %uh take the Night Safari and do the show?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh both the Night Safari and the Jurong Bird Park?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: 'Cause I want to spend the whole day in that area with the Jurong Bird Park and then on the Night Safari and then-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For the adult it's fifty eight dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the child is thirty eight dollars for the three parks.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you can do is you do the Jurong Bird Park in the morning, there's a zoo in the afternoon and the Night Safari in the night time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah and that's like a full day programme already.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the night before, get a good rest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: 'Cause you're doing three parks in one day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm going to %um travel all over.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm gonna visit Singapore, the whole Singapore if- for three days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the following day, you can get a bird's eye view of Singapore by going to take a ride on the Singapore Flyer.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh no. I'm afraid of Ferris wheel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But my sister could %um- my sister and nephew could.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you stay on the ground and take pictures for them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's like a %uh cable car that goes in a circle.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um if it's enclosed, I think I might consider.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because the Ferris wheel here %uh are open, so I'm afraid of them.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if it's enclosed, I think %um I would have the courage to take the ride.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do that and again if you want to do some local food the ground floor area there is another %uh food centre on the ground floor area.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh is that a bay beside the Ferris wheel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's just very close by.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can go to again, okay, that's another view of the %uh Singapore Flyer it's like a cabin.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and then you saw the bay, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you walk on this %uh bridge, a very interesting bridge that looks like our %uh DNA bridge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: To go to the Marina Bay Sands.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: At the Marina Bay %um %um are they allowed to %um swimming?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay, %uh yah, unless you are guest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and you are staying at the Mari~ of course yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh otherwise, if you want to again have a bird's eye view, %uh from Singapore to the South China Sea, to the City Centre, %uh you can buy a ticket to go up to the SkyPark.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, right on top of the %uh three hotels.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see now the SkyPark?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you see the sea view, so that is towards %uh the South China Sea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, %uh from a three, number three, right up to number seven you will see the City- Singapore City view.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, so it- could you see a very good view %uh of the skyline?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: if you wanted to see both, so you'll have to be number eight I guess.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you can walk around, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the cost of a ticket-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's twenty dollars for an adult and fourteen dollars for a child.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %um once you come down, okay, you walk across the %uh underpass.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can do the restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, there are lots of restaurants out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm they have- if you like Chinese food, then maybe I can recommend you Ding Tai Fung.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are lots of other kind of a cuisine out here in the %uh Marina Bay Sands area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay and of course but I guess with a kid, you may want to go to the casino, huh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I leave him with his mother.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then I go to the casino myself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the casino is just in the basement area, so you can have %uh some fun out in the casino as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you can even do %uh the museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there any place that %um let say I'm in the Marina Bay %um Marina Bay Sands, %um is there any place for- where we could left off the children and then %um do the casino?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %um because %um %um here there are %uh places in malls were we could like %um %uh leave the children and then we go to shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then the children will play on that area, and then we'll get them once we're done.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, in the Marina Bay Sands yes there is but not in all the other mall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh only selected ones %uh do offer this service.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could do that, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I think he could be interested in this %uh Arts and Science %uh Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: in the Marina Bay Sands as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is %uh the permanent %uh gallery.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, that's what you will see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's all about Arts and Science.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you could do that and that would be almost %uh more than half a day already.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And but of course again you can do a spot of %uh shopping out there as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so %um a while ago I'll-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I don't know which %um- I saw flea market here on the website, I don't know where would that lead me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So do you have like %um flea markets in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's in the Clarke Quay area It's on Sunday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise we do have a flea market %uh in Sungei Road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um I have heard about something like Little India.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what do %um- what are- is there any activities that I could get %um- do in Little India?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, let me just show you the flea market in %uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay these are the flea market.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's operates everyday %uh from four P.M. onwards.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh they really sell all kinds of stuff in this flea market.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and we want to go to Little India, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: In Little India, do all people are Indians?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just that %uh traditionally, this was a %uh an Indian quarters.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, now, I'm showing you some of the images in Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the first picture is a light up %uh in this festival which normally happens in August.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this is one of the street, the second picture will show you %uh street in Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The third one is this food is called Rojak.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It means like %uh mix and match of various kinds of food that you like.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they serve you with this orangey kind of gravy which is a little bit sweet and just a tinge of spice in there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm and the things are deep fried.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The next picture again quite commonly seen in Little India, these are flower garland shop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the white flowers that you see will be Jasmine flower.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh these flower garlands are brought by the Hindus when they go to the temple, the Indian Temples to offer their prayers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they offer these flower garlands to their gods.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then we just move downwards.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You see a very elaborate structure?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is the main entrance of a Hindu Temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, again more street scenes in Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, another food that is served in Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So some of the local food will be like vadi.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: vadi looks a little bit like a doughnut.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Normally the store owner will give you a green chili as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you take a bite on the green chili and a bite of this vadi

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so more of like spicy foods.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you don't want to eat the chili, then you just eat the doughnut.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, %uh it's like- it's called vadi.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that gives you a little bit of an idea of what %uh Little India has.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Here again more pictures of what Little India has.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you may want to do a temporary tattoo which we call it Henna painting.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, I will love to do that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That will cost you about five dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, some %uh souvenirs in case you want to buy will be like brassware.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Boxes, the jewellery boxes, %uh jewellery boxes made of wood.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay hanging things, ornaments for the house.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Plastic bangles a bunch of them would cost you a few dollars, about five dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The next picture that I am highlighting will be %uh a sari that is five point five metres.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you wrap it around your waist and you wear with a short blouse.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are traditionally worn by the South Indians.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is what we can do in Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Lots of se- pictures out here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and then I'm going to highlight this one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can either eat this with a curry or you can have side dishes like tandoori and you can see they are served on banana leaf.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is the traditional way of eating Indian food, and you eat with your hands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course there are hotels there located in Little India as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Lots of picture for you %uh to see %uh okay and the souvenir that I'm talking about, these are jewellery %uh boxes that I highlighted to you here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Teens that we will see in Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The MRT train station is called Little India MRT train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could do again the like three hours, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the temporary tattoo will last you for about seven days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you don't wash your hands of course it'll last longer.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is the temporary tattoo made from the Henna plant.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um basically %um now I'm really interested to go in Singapore, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think you will have quite a packed programme in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So is there anything else that I could help you with?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think you have help me a lot.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um I think %um that's about it.
